creator: sriramsiv@hotmail.com
text:
I have to render a PDF that contains a SVG in it.  I am using FOP 0.20.5 
version.  The PDF is generated fine on a Windows 2000 system.  I have jdk1.3 
and BEA 5.1 running.  When I move the same code to Solaris box, I am getting 
the following error

Exception caught writing response PDF in responsePDF(BufferedReader, 
InputStream): org.w3c.dom.DOMException: The current node (type: 2, name: 
contentStyleType) is read-only.
org.w3c.dom.DOMException: The current node (type: 2, name: contentStyleType) is 
read-only.
		 at org.apache.batik.dom.AbstractNode.createDOMException
(AbstractNode.java:368)
		 at org.apache.batik.dom.AbstractAttr.setNodeValue
(AbstractAttr.java:113)
		 at org.apache.batik.dom.AbstractAttr.setValue
(AbstractAttr.java:177)
		 at 
org.apache.batik.dom.svg.AbstractElement$ExtendedNamedNodeHashMap.setUnspecified
Attribute(AbstractElement.java:238)
		 at 
org.apache.batik.dom.svg.AbstractElement.setUnspecifiedAttribute
(AbstractElement.java:149)
		 at org.apache.batik.dom.svg.AttributeInitializer.resetAttribute
(AttributeInitializer.java:94)

org.apache.batik.dom.svg.AttributeInitializer.initializeAttributes
(AttributeInitializer.java:70)

(SVGOMSVGElement.java:103)

		 at 
org.apache.batik.dom.svg.SVGDOMImplementation.createElementNS
(SVGDOMImplementation.java:255)

(SVGOMDocument.java:338)
		 at org.apache.batik.dom.svg.SVGDOMImplementation.createDocument
(SVGDOMImplementation.java:175)
		 at org.apache.fop.svg.SVGElement.init(SVGElement.java:255)
		 at org.apache.fop.svg.SVGElement.<init>(SVGElement.java:120)
		 at org.apache.fop.svg.SVGElement$Maker.make(SVGElement.java:95)
		 at org.apache.fop.fo.FOTreeBuilder.startElement
(FOTreeBuilder.java:352)
		 at org.apache.xerces.parsers.AbstractSAXParser.startElement
(AbstractSAXParser.java:459)

(XMLNamespaceBinder.java:877)

(XMLNamespaceBinder.java:569)

org.apache.xerces.impl.XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl.scanStartElement
(XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl.java:759)
		 at 
org.apache.xerces.impl.XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl$FragmentContentDispatcher.
dispatch(XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl.java:1477)
		 at 
org.apache.xerces.impl.XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl.scanDocument
(XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl.java:329)
		 at org.apache.xerces.parsers.DTDConfiguration.parse
(DTDConfiguration.java:525)
		 at org.apache.xerces.parsers.DTDConfiguration.parse
(DTDConfiguration.java:581)
		 at org.apache.xerces.parsers.XMLParser.parse
(XMLParser.java:152)

creator: deweese@apache.org
text:
I don't really know where to go with this.

I've never seen this problem, and looking at the code it isn't
clear how it could happen.

creator: deweese@apache.org
text:
Since I have recieved no futher info I'm closing the bug.
Feel free to reopen if you want to provide info.
